ygData.subject: Re: JBoots (the ever popular)
ygData.msgSnippet: LoL - I like your sense of humor.  Guk hm, and woven?  You re right, that is going to take some traveling shoes... but come to think of it, I don t have any
ygData.messageBody:
LoL - I like your sense of humor. Guk hm, and woven? You're right, that is
going to take some traveling shoes... but come to think of it, I don't have
any shoes. :-) hehe Yes I really need an equipment upgrade. I go through
Freeport down through the Desert, no?

Ahh..not solo.. hm, problem there is the binding. I know one person who
would go with me, is there a place around there I could bind somebody so
they don't have to run all the way back from Freeport? How I wish there
wasn't the silly starting city only limitation.

Thanks for the advice, I'll put it on the future sight seeing list. *grin*

~Shadow

----- Original Message -----
From: Amy Pratt <sfpratt@...>
To: <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, August 19, 1999 6:44 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] JBoots (the ever popular)


> From: "Amy Pratt" <sfpratt@...>
>
> Grab your little piles of bones and put your travelling shoes on and head
> for Guk. It's down in Innothule swamp next to the troll city. There
you'll
> find tons of little froggies just dying (sorry for the pun, couldn't
resist)
> to give you their woven armor.
>
> A warning, though. Don't do it solo and check your pet with the coat girl
> at the door unless you're extremely talented at keeping it under control.
> I've seen so many pet related train deaths in that dungeon that those cute
> little skeletons ought to come with a warning label from the surgeon
> general.
>
> Kaelrie (The Crimson Knights), DE necro on Fennin Ro.
